meanings.definition: To break up or dissolve (a group or organization)
meanings.sent1: The team decided to disband after the season ended.
meanings.sent2: The government had to disband the rebel group for safety reasons.
meanings.sent3: The band had to disband because their instruments were all made of cheese!
meanings.sent4: The music festival had to disband the crowd like a storm scattering leaves.
meanings.sent5: The decision to disband the club was as final as a door slamming shut.

meanings.definition: To disperse or scatter (members of a group)
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to disband the students after the bell rang.
meanings.sent2: The police had to disband the protesters to maintain order.
meanings.sent3: The ants had to disband their line when they encountered a river of chocolate.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to disband the clouds, revealing the bright blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to disband the cards and then make them reappear in order.

meanings.definition: To cease to function as a unit or organization
meanings.sent1: The old computer system began to disband, causing errors.
meanings.sent2: The company had to disband due to financial difficulties.
meanings.sent3: The superhero team had to disband temporarily to work on their solo projects.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the painting seemed to disband, creating a beautiful abstract effect.
meanings.sent5: The friendship started to disband like sand slipping through fingers.
